newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Von Moos plunges into 187.4 mln net loss.
newsitem.headline: Von Moos plunges into 187.4 mln net loss.

text.p: Swiss steel group Von Moos Holding AG said it made an ordinary loss of 53.2 million Swiss francs in 1996, but due to extraordinary restructuring charges and writedowns of 133.8 million, the net loss amounted to 187.4 million francs.

Von Moos, Switzerland's last remaining steel producer, also said in a statement its share capital, boosted by 160 million francs in a 1996 capital rise, fell to 175.7 million at the end of December 1996 from 355.0 million end-1995 due to valuation adjustments against equity.
In 1995 Von Moos had reported a group profit of 6.5 million francs.

But Von Moos said restructuring measures under way and the recent swap bank debt into equity, had created the conditions for Von Moos to again earn an appropriate return on its capital by 1999 at the latest.

Despite the first-time consolidation of the steel works taken over from Von Roll, von Moos' 1996 sales fell to 590.4 million francs from 644.3 milion due to lower sales volume and significantly lower steel prices.

Von Moos' 1996 operating result showed a loss of 56.2 million from a profit of 26.8 million in 1995 and the operating cash flow was a negative 18 million compared with a positive cash flow of 62.2 million in 1995.
